Name: Tomato Bacterial Spot
Description: Tomato bacterial spot is a plant disease caused by the bacteria Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria. It affects the leaves, stems, and fruits of tomato plants, causing circular lesions with a water-soaked appearance that may later turn brown or black. The disease can cause significant yield losses in infected crops and can also spread rapidly through the field.

Treatments.Cultural practices: Include removing infected plant debris and avoiding overhead irrigation

Products.Copper Hydroxide: It is effective against a wide range of fungal diseases that affect crops, such as powdery mildew, downy mildew, and leaf spots.

Products.Copper Oxychloride: It is a copper-based compound that is effective against many fungal diseases, including anthracnose, blight, and rust.
